markdownRemark.html:
Deepfake is an AI technology that digitally alters a person’s face so that they appear to be someone else. It is often used with bad intentions. We turned the tables and found a use for good. Blocktag uses deepfake to digitally alter an original tag so that you can anticipate how counterfeit tags look like.

Deep Learning For Print Physics

Blocktag’s deepfake technology learns the physics of printing to predict how photocopied tags printed on different printer models will look like. Below is an image rendering of deepfake reprints and photocopies.

Deep Learning For Camera Resolution Correction

Blocktag can also use AI to customize how deepfake tags look like on different phone cameras. Because cameras with different resolutions perceive the printed original tag at different sharpness.

3D Space Visualisation For Deepfake Authentication

Blocktag uses deepfakes to improve authentication accuracy. As we collect more training data from user authentications to train our deep learning model, there are more deepfake datapoints to tighten the authentication criteria.

Deepfake empowers consumers as anti-counterfeiting's first line of defense. Before counterfeiters try to fake it till they make it.

ChunMing Chin
Cofounder, Director of Engineering
Blocktag Inc

frontmatter.title: Predict Counterfeit Tags With Deepfake
frontmatter.meta_description: "Blocktag uses deepfake to digitally alter an original tag so that you can anticipate how counterfeit tags look like."
